fxInfo_clarification: If several bodies were involved in the appointment process, select the one that exerted the most critical impact on the decision. However, in the next question we ask separately about whether the approval of the legislature was necessary. Response category 8 should only be selected if the head of government is directly elected, not if he or she was appointed by the legislature after an election.
fxInfo_notes: Converted from (B) to (A) coding. v2expathhg is coded according to appointment dates of the Head of Government. The same is true for coups or rebellions where the date when the HOG was appointed through a coup, or the first day in office after the coup, is coded.
fxInfo_ordering: If you select 0 or 9, proceed to the next question [v2exothhgl]. If you selected 1-6, skip to question "HOG selection by legislature in practice" [v2exaphogp]. If you selected 7-8, skip to question [v2excomex].
fxInfo_question: How did the head of government gain access to office?

fxInfo_responses.value: Through the threat of or application of force, such as a coup or rebellion.
Appointed by the ruling party (in a one-party system).
Appointed by the head of state.
Directly through a popular election (regardless of the extension of the suffrage).

fxInfo_scale: Nominal (v2expathhg), or a series of dichotomous scales
